meanings.definition: A substance produced by a living organism that acts as a catalyst to bring about a specific biochemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The enzyme in the plant helped break down the food.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how enzymes work in our bodies.
meanings.sent3: The enzyme at the party made sure everyone had enough snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an enzyme, spreading joy to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The enzyme was like a tiny worker, speeding up the chemical reactions.

meanings.definition: A protein that speeds up chemical reactions in the body.
meanings.sent1: An enzyme in the body helps digest food faster.
meanings.sent2: Athletes need enzymes to keep their muscles strong.
meanings.sent3: The enzyme in the gym made sure everyone exercised properly.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like an enzyme, pushing him to achieve his goals.
meanings.sent5: The enzyme acted like a superhero, saving the day with its quick actions.

meanings.definition: A biological catalyst that speeds up chemical reactions in living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The enzyme in the fish helped it swim faster.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how enzymes function in different animals.
meanings.sent3: The enzyme in the zoo made sure all the animals were happy.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like an enzyme, spreading positivity wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The enzyme worked tirelessly, ensuring all reactions happened swiftly.
